::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module3_mcq_q21')" data-correct-answer="D">
<strong style="display: block;">
Under CAPM, a stock with β=0.8, risk-free rate 4%, and market expected return 12% should have what expected return?
</strong>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q21" value="A"> A. 9.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q21" value="B"> B. 9.6%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q21" value="C"> C. 10.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q21" value="D"> D. 10.4%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q21" value="E"> E. 12.0%</label><br>
</form>
<div id="feedback-module3_mcq_q21" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: D. E(R)=rf+β(E(Rm)−rf)=4%+0.8×8%=10.4%.
</div>
:::
